text: Lithocarpus daphnoideus is a tree in the beech family Fagaceae. The specific epithet ' is from the Greek meaning "like Daphne", referring to the genus Daphne and its leaves. ==Description== Lithocarpus daphnoideus grows as a tree up to tall with a trunk diameter of up to . The greyish brown bark is smooth or fissured. The coriaceous leaves measure up to long. Its dark brownish or red-brown acorns are conical or ovoid and measure up to across. ==Distribution and habitat== Lithocarpus daphnoideus grows naturally in Sumatra, Peninsular Malaysia, Java and Borneo. Its habitat is hill dipterocarp to lower montane forests up to altitude. ==References== daphnoideus Category:Trees of Sumatra Category:Trees of Peninsular Malaysia Category:Trees of Java Category:Trees of Borneo Category:Plants described in 1829
title: Lithocarpus daphnoideus
